alert.note: Alert for Chester; Philadelphia (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 09 at 9:50PM EDT until July 10 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Schuylkill River At Pottstown affecting Montgomery County. Schuylkill River At Norristown affecting Montgomery, Chester, and Philadelphia Counties. Schuylkill River At Philadelphia affecting Montgomery and Philadelphia Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Schuylkill River At Norristown. * WHEN...From late tonight to late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 12.5 feet, Flooding occurs in West Norriton. The West Indian Lane bridge begins to flood. At 13.0 feet, Water begins to cover and close Riverview Boulevard in West Norriton. At 15.0 feet, River Road in West Conshohocken begins to flood. The lower garages at the Riverview Landing and the Lofts at Valley Forge start to take on water. The lower section of Port Indian Road in West Norriton becomes impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM EDT Sunday the stage was 8.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 14.0 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.8 feet on 12/01/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (8 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Stg Time Date Schuylkill River Norristown 13.0 8.9 Sun 8 pm 13.0 10.1 14.0 8am 7/10 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued Monday morning by 1000 AM EDT.
